title: Does Kenya have one of the worst maternal mortality rates in the world?
subtitle: In an appeal for funds, a British charity made two startling claims about the fate of Kenya’s mothers and young children. We checked them out.
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
• None In a funding drive, a British charity said Kenya had one of the worst maternal mortality rates in the world, and over one in 20 children died before their fifth birthday.
• None According to UN estimates, Kenya is one of 21 countries with a very high ratio of maternal deaths.
• None Different studies estimate the under-five mortality ratio at roughly one in 20, which an expert said was “a fair statement”.

Data on the maternal mortality ratio, on the other hand, is widely available.

The data covered 1990 to 2015 and showed Kenya had 510 maternal deaths for every 100,000 live births. Nigeria and India accounted for 34% of all maternal deaths, with sub-Saharan Africa countries accounting for 20 of the 21 countries.

“So it is not ‘off the mark’ for the charity to make such a claim,” Chou said.
